isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - STOPMASTER WEDGE TYPE BRAKE - MAINTENANCE - GENERAL

svcsubproc.title: 25,000 to 30,000 Miles (40,000 to 48,000 km) or Every Two Months

step1.para: Check lining wear to determine proper reline time.
When automatic adjusters are used, check lining to brake drum clearance. Adjusters are working properly if clearance at the inspection hole is between .010 to .060 inch (0.254 to 1.524 mm).

svcsubproc.para: For brakes utilizing one (1) spring chamber per wheel, clearance in excess of .035 inch (0.899 mm) may require manual adjustment to obtain optimum performance until vehicle can be scheduled for maintenance.
The foregoing dimensions are established as a guide, only to indicate a range and not a precise specification. Specific situations may differ due to various combinations of drums and linings.

step1.para: Check service and spring brake air systems by cycling the respective application valves.

step2.para: Service brakes are checked by applying the foot valve and observing brake action to determine correct actuation and lining to drum contact.
Spring brake is checked by actuating the control valve on the instrument panel.

svcsubproc.title: 100,000 Miles (160,000 km) or Once Each Year

warning.para: A spring brake contains a very powerful compression spring. Failure to comply with all of the following instructions may result in forceful release of the spring chamber and its contents which could cause death, severe personal injury and/or property damage.

step1.para: Cage spring brakes and remove hub and drum assemblies. Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the type spring brake being serviced.
If seals are cut, torn, or leaking, disassemble and overhaul brake actuating components.
If seals are in good condition, remove pawl assembly and then remove the adjusting plunger and its seal to check internal condition.
If grease is contaminated or hardened, or if parts are dry, disassemble and overhaul brake actuating components.
Satisfactory or overhauled units must be lubricated and reassembled. Replace seal using appropriate seal driver. Reassemble pawl and manually adjust brake. For Lubrication refer to LUBRICATE.
Highly polished parts do not mean replacement is necessary. Replace components which are scored or show signs of wear. Refer to TROUBLESHOOT.
